HDG.LOG.content: engage (einlassen) ourselves with a question which probably decides many things: how does proper sense of legein, to lay, come to mean saying and talking? > find a foothold (Anhalt) > to lay is to gather (legen ist lesen)
HDG.LOG.linkedContent: engage (einlassen) ourselves with a question which probably decides many things: how does proper sense of legein, to lay, come to mean saying and talking? > find a foothold (Anhalt) > to lay is to gather (legen ist lesen)

HDG.IM.content: adding “instead of nothing” prevents beginning directly w/ beings as unquestionably given [?] > forfeit the self-evidence of beings > cannot wholly belong to any thing, not even ourselves ([still] Da-sein “in each case mine”) > in this question, beings come to waver (btwn Being and not-Being), questioning loses secure foothold, Dasein comes into suspense, maintains itself in suspense [what kind of maintenance is this?]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: adding “instead of nothing” prevents beginning directly w/ beings as unquestionably given [?] > forfeit the self-evidence of beings > cannot wholly belong to any thing, not even ourselves ([still] Da-sein “in each case mine”) > in this question, beings come to waver (btwn Being and not-Being), questioning loses secure foothold, Dasein comes into suspense, maintains itself in suspense [what kind of maintenance is this?]

HDG.IM.content: Nietzsche dismissive, “Being” is a deception that shouldn’t have happened [that’s a rather dismissive view of Nietzsche’s subtlety] > [regardless of answer to Nietzsche, Heidegger will not relinquish strategy of “aura” of question] [moral image of thought]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: Nietzsche dismissive, “Being” is a deception that shouldn’t have happened [that’s a rather dismissive view of Nietzsche’s subtlety] > [regardless of answer to Nietzsche, Heidegger will not relinquish strategy of “aura” of question] [moral image of thought]

HDG.IM.content: we’ve fallen out of what word “Being” is saying > even if one can’t understand question of Being, even when asked in more originary way—question still inevitable
HDG.IM.linkedContent: we’ve fallen out of what word “Being” is saying > even if one can’t understand question of Being, even when asked in more originary way—question still inevitable

HDG.IM.content: word ontology coined in 17th century, question no longer originary > “ontology”: effort to put Being into words, to pass through question of how it stands w/ Being
HDG.IM.linkedContent: word ontology coined in 17th century, question no longer originary > “ontology”: effort to put Being into words, to pass through question of how it stands w/ Being

HDG.IM.content: from question “Why are there beings at all instead of nothing?” we’ve extracted the prior question (Vor-frage): How does it stand w/ Being? [Nietzsche’s putting first last [fixerup]]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: from question “Why are there beings at all instead of nothing?” we’ve extracted the prior question (Vor-frage): How does it stand w/ Being? [Nietzsche’s putting first last [fixerup]]

HDG.IM.content: is Being a mere word or does it hold spiritual fate of the West? > this question may sound forced [method: demonstrate by way of assertion] [but the bell tolls, and we count wrong—even our experience of the question]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: is Being a mere word or does it hold spiritual fate of the West? > this question may sound forced [method: demonstrate by way of assertion] [but the bell tolls, and we count wrong—even our experience of the question]

HDG.IM.content: only in philosophy that essential relations to beings always take shape [but you still have not answered Nietzsche’s question]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: only in philosophy that essential relations to beings always take shape [but you still have not answered Nietzsche’s question]

HDG.IM.content: asking of the fundamental metaphysical question is historical: opens up happening of human Dasein in its essential relations > opens to futures to come (Zu-künften), thus binds back to inception > a non-derivative call/summoning of Dasein to its history, call to make a decision
HDG.IM.linkedContent: asking of the fundamental metaphysical question is historical: opens up happening of human Dasein in its essential relations > opens to futures to come (Zu-künften), thus binds back to inception > a non-derivative call/summoning of Dasein to its history, call to make a decision

HDG.IM.content: spirit is what sustains/rules, first & last [first last], not merely indispensable 3rd element > cultural values secure meaning, restricted to their standards of self-validity: poetry for poetry’s sake, art for art’s sake, science for science’s sake > [no longer question thus no longer spiritual?] > re: science and situation of university, a situation unchanged despite some cleansing [Nazi?]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: spirit is what sustains/rules, first & last [first last], not merely indispensable 3rd element > cultural values secure meaning, restricted to their standards of self-validity: poetry for poetry’s sake, art for art’s sake, science for science’s sake > [no longer question thus no longer spiritual?] > re: science and situation of university, a situation unchanged despite some cleansing [Nazi?]

HDG.IM.content: knowing resolution to essence of Being (from Rectoral Address) [but you haven’t answered Nietzsche’s question yet!!!] > [spirit is Being of beings?] [spirit as authenticator of beings]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: knowing resolution to essence of Being (from Rectoral Address) [but you haven’t answered Nietzsche’s question yet!!!] > [spirit is Being of beings?] [spirit as authenticator of beings]

HDG.IM.content: [doesn’t respond to Nietzsche, just props hermeneutics of historicity btwn question & its answer]
HDG.IM.linkedContent: [doesn’t respond to Nietzsche, just props hermeneutics of historicity btwn question & its answer]

HDG.BC.content: more difficult to say how “being” belongs to subject than object? > flight from object to subject a questionable way out of question of “being”
HDG.BC.linkedContent: more difficult to say how “being” belongs to subject than object? > flight from object to subject a questionable way out of question of “being”

HDG.BC.content: Heidegger asks whether the determinations of Being are arbitrary, whether he is using the device of opposition: he postpones a decision re: these questions [does he return?]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: Heidegger asks whether the determinations of Being are arbitrary, whether he is using the device of opposition: he postpones a decision re: these questions [does he return?]

HDG.BC.content: relinquishing thought most deplorable way for thought to accomplish task [re: refusing to rely on “paradox”]: give up question of Being as pseudoquestion, or acknowledge exposed impasse (“aporia”) (must come to terms w/ it in some way) [how to treat Derrida’s aporia?] > impasse that Being brings w/ it is its mark of distinction (eigene Auszeichnung)[mark prior to Being? differance] > acc. Heidegger, to call impasse (Ausweglosigkeit) “aporia” is to close eyes at impasse [?] [Heidegger beyond Derrida?]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: relinquishing thought most deplorable way for thought to accomplish task [re: refusing to rely on “paradox”]: give up question of Being as pseudoquestion, or acknowledge exposed impasse (“aporia”) (must come to terms w/ it in some way) [how to treat Derrida’s aporia?] > impasse that Being brings w/ it is its mark of distinction (eigene Auszeichnung)[mark prior to Being? differance] > acc. Heidegger, to call impasse (Ausweglosigkeit) “aporia” is to close eyes at impasse [?] [Heidegger beyond Derrida?]

HDG.BC.content: [answers question on p. 66?] doesn’t such reflection upon Being run counter to every natural self-consciousness of man? animal rationale doesn’t exclude possibility to expand consideration of man [same goes for your arguments]
HDG.BC.linkedContent: [answers question on p. 66?] doesn’t such reflection upon Being run counter to every natural self-consciousness of man? animal rationale doesn’t exclude possibility to expand consideration of man [same goes for your arguments]

HDG.BT.content: question of Being, fundamental ontology, must be sought in existential analytic of Dasein
HDG.BT.linkedContent: question of Being, fundamental ontology, must be sought in existential analytic of Dasein

HDG.BT.content: existentiality as inquiry into meaning of Being > question of meaning of Being understands itself as historiological [?]
HDG.BT.linkedContent: existentiality as inquiry into meaning of Being > question of meaning of Being understands itself as historiological [?]

HDG.BT.content: [destruction not deconstruction] taking question of Being as our clue, we are to destroy traditional content of ancient ontology, until we arrive at primordial experiences [utterly impossible for Derrida] that achieved 1st ways of determining nature of Being (the ways that have guided us ever since [our destiny])
HDG.BT.linkedContent: [destruction not deconstruction] taking question of Being as our clue, we are to destroy traditional content of ancient ontology, until we arrive at primordial experiences [utterly impossible for Derrida] that achieved 1st ways of determining nature of Being (the ways that have guided us ever since [our destiny])

HDG.BT.content: full extent of influence of medieval failure re: ontology can’t be estimated until meaning & limitations of ancient ontology have been exhibited in terms of orientation directed toward question of Being
HDG.BT.linkedContent: full extent of influence of medieval failure re: ontology can’t be estimated until meaning & limitations of ancient ontology have been exhibited in terms of orientation directed toward question of Being

HDG.BT.content: question of Being doesn’t achieve its true concreteness until we’ve carried through process of destroying ontological tradition [telos?]
HDG.BT.linkedContent: question of Being doesn’t achieve its true concreteness until we’ve carried through process of destroying ontological tradition [telos?]

HDG.BT.content: in investigations where thing is deeply veiled, don’t overestimate results: constantly face possibility of disclosing an even more primordial/universal horizon from which to draw answer to question: “What is Being?” [Seinsfrage] > must reawaken question of Being before achieving positive results, arrive at a field where we can come to terms w/ it in a way that can be controlled [totally other—then teleological control?]
HDG.BT.linkedContent: in investigations where thing is deeply veiled, don’t overestimate results: constantly face possibility of disclosing an even more primordial/universal horizon from which to draw answer to question: “What is Being?” [Seinsfrage] > must reawaken question of Being before achieving positive results, arrive at a field where we can come to terms w/ it in a way that can be controlled [totally other—then teleological control?]

HDG.WM.content: “preliminary sketch (vorbereitenden Kennzeichung)” of our undertaking (Beginnens) > each metaphysical question always the whole range of metaphysical questions
HDG.WM.linkedContent: “preliminary sketch (vorbereitenden Kennzeichung)” of our undertaking (Beginnens) > each metaphysical question always the whole range of metaphysical questions

HDG.WM.content: “what is the nothing?”: every answer to this question impossible from start; re: nothing, question/answer inherently absurd > nothing is negation of totality of beings, nonbeing pure & simple > the question, the problem, the logic, the problem only devours itself [?] (nur sich selbst verzehrendes Problem ansetzen)
HDG.WM.linkedContent: “what is the nothing?”: every answer to this question impossible from start; re: nothing, question/answer inherently absurd > nothing is negation of totality of beings, nonbeing pure & simple > the question, the problem, the logic, the problem only devours itself [?] (nur sich selbst verzehrendes Problem ansetzen)

HDG.WM.content: nothing more originary than negation, given > absurdity of question of nothing due to a blind conceit of intellect? > not be misled by formal impossibility > if nothing is to be questioned as we have been questioning it, must be given beforehand [facticity]
HDG.WM.linkedContent: nothing more originary than negation, given > absurdity of question of nothing due to a blind conceit of intellect? > not be misled by formal impossibility > if nothing is to be questioned as we have been questioning it, must be given beforehand [facticity]

HDG.WM.content: nothing awakens for 1st time proper formulation of metaphysical question re: Being of beings > nothing not as indeterminate opposite of beings, unveils itself as belonging to Being of beings > agrees w/ Hegel’s “Pure Being and pure Nothing are therefore the same” [also quoted in HDG.BC]
HDG.WM.linkedContent: nothing awakens for 1st time proper formulation of metaphysical question re: Being of beings > nothing not as indeterminate opposite of beings, unveils itself as belonging to Being of beings > agrees w/ Hegel’s “Pure Being and pure Nothing are therefore the same” [also quoted in HDG.BC]

HDG.WM.content: for philosophy to get underway: 1) allow space for beings as a whole 2) release ourselves into the nothing, liberate ourselves from idols 3) let sweep of our suspense (Schwebens) take its full course, so it swings back to fundamental question of metaphysics [possibility of “why” makes it possible to ground things > destiny of our existence placed in hands of researcher (Forschers) (Nietzsche)] [destiny, question, ground of metaphysics, beyond metaphysics]
HDG.WM.linkedContent: for philosophy to get underway: 1) allow space for beings as a whole 2) release ourselves into the nothing, liberate ourselves from idols 3) let sweep of our suspense (Schwebens) take its full course, so it swings back to fundamental question of metaphysics [possibility of “why” makes it possible to ground things > destiny of our existence placed in hands of researcher (Forschers) (Nietzsche)] [destiny, question, ground of metaphysics, beyond metaphysics]

HDG.IWM.content: overcoming of metaphysics [Destruction] corresponded to endeavor to first learn to attend to oblivion of Being, to experience this oblivion, absorb this experience into relation of Being to man, preserve (verwahren) it there [ontological difference & Being] > in the need (Not) belonging to oblivion of Being, question: “What is metaphysics?” perhaps most necessary for thought > [Destruction] representational thought relinquished to thinking brought to pass (ereignetes) by Being itself, in thrall to Being (um dem Sein höriges Denken) [MOP, telos]: more thoughtful our thinking becomes, more purely our thinking will stand of its own accord in sole action appropriate to it [attention to Being]
HDG.IWM.linkedContent: overcoming of metaphysics [Destruction] corresponded to endeavor to first learn to attend to oblivion of Being, to experience this oblivion, absorb this experience into relation of Being to man, preserve (verwahren) it there [ontological difference & Being] > in the need (Not) belonging to oblivion of Being, question: “What is metaphysics?” perhaps most necessary for thought > [Destruction] representational thought relinquished to thinking brought to pass (ereignetes) by Being itself, in thrall to Being (um dem Sein höriges Denken) [MOP, telos]: more thoughtful our thinking becomes, more purely our thinking will stand of its own accord in sole action appropriate to it [attention to Being]

HDG.IWM.content: for a preliminary orientation, nothing more necessary than question: “What is metaphysics?”
HDG.IWM.linkedContent: for a preliminary orientation, nothing more necessary than question: “What is metaphysics?”

HDG.IWM.content: Nothing understood as Being itself > Heidegger reframes fundamental question of metaphysics: “how does it come about that with Being It [cf. 290n For metaphysics] is really nothing and that the Nothing does not properly prevail?” [i.e. how does metaphysics forget Being as Nothing?]
HDG.IWM.linkedContent: Nothing understood as Being itself > Heidegger reframes fundamental question of metaphysics: “how does it come about that with Being It [cf. 290n For metaphysics] is really nothing and that the Nothing does not properly prevail?” [i.e. how does metaphysics forget Being as Nothing?]

HDG.QB.content: “Question concerning Technology” owes lasting debt to descriptions in The Worker
HDG.QB.linkedContent: “Question concerning Technology” owes lasting debt to descriptions in The Worker

HDG.QB.content: for Jünger, technology most decisive anti-Christian power [?] > [Heidegger unloads w/ questions re: Gestalt] >Heidegger finds in Jünger a circular logic beyond “logic” that demands freedom from contradiction: reciprocal relationship btwn determinative (work) & determined (worker)
HDG.QB.linkedContent: for Jünger, technology most decisive anti-Christian power [?] > [Heidegger unloads w/ questions re: Gestalt] >Heidegger finds in Jünger a circular logic beyond “logic” that demands freedom from contradiction: reciprocal relationship btwn determinative (work) & determined (worker)

HDG.QB.content: [immense degree of waiting] perhaps moment will come [not yet] when essence of nihilism will show itself more clearly in other ways, in brighter light, until then setting out on a path that leads to a discussion of essence of Being, on this path alone can question concerning the nothing be discussed (must relinquish language of metaphysics [does that include Being?], but [still?] subject to other demands than changing an old terminology for a new one [paleonym] > endeavor to undertake transformation will presumably remain tentative for a long time [not yet there, telos], that’s not an adequate reason for failing to undertake it
HDG.QB.linkedContent: [immense degree of waiting] perhaps moment will come [not yet] when essence of nihilism will show itself more clearly in other ways, in brighter light, until then setting out on a path that leads to a discussion of essence of Being, on this path alone can question concerning the nothing be discussed (must relinquish language of metaphysics [does that include Being?], but [still?] subject to other demands than changing an old terminology for a new one [paleonym] > endeavor to undertake transformation will presumably remain tentative for a long time [not yet there, telos], that’s not an adequate reason for failing to undertake it

HDG.QB.content: Being resides (beruht) w/in the turning (Zuwendung) [of Being] (“turning” a makeshift measure [Notbehelf], worthy of question)
HDG.QB.linkedContent: Being resides (beruht) w/in the turning (Zuwendung) [of Being] (“turning” a makeshift measure [Notbehelf], worthy of question)

HDG.QB.content: by no means easier to say “being” than to speak of the nothing > shows how once more, inevitably, everything depends (ankommt) on correct saying (rechte Sagen), the logos whose essence logic/dialectic of metaphysics can never experience > is it due to “being” (as Same) that our saying fails? all too readily suspected as so-called “mysticism”? > [beyond Being, Derrida] would the crossing of the line leave language of fundamental words to whim of those who are speaking? enough for language to be universally comprehensible? or do other [uniquely unique] laws/measures prevail here [totally other]? (these questions are scarcely beginning to become worthy of question—to feel home in them)
HDG.QB.linkedContent: by no means easier to say “being” than to speak of the nothing > shows how once more, inevitably, everything depends (ankommt) on correct saying (rechte Sagen), the logos whose essence logic/dialectic of metaphysics can never experience > is it due to “being” (as Same) that our saying fails? all too readily suspected as so-called “mysticism”? > [beyond Being, Derrida] would the crossing of the line leave language of fundamental words to whim of those who are speaking? enough for language to be universally comprehensible? or do other [uniquely unique] laws/measures prevail here [totally other]? (these questions are scarcely beginning to become worthy of question—to feel home in them)

HDG.QB.content: when question “What is…?” concerned w/ discussing (erörtern) the surpassing (Überstieg) of beings by Being, this surpassing immediately calls into question elements distinguished from one another in that distinction (Unterscheidung) [beyond ontological difference], the distinction in which doctrine of metaphysics moves, or from which metaphysics receives basic outline (Grundriss) of its language (essence/existence, what-being/that-being)
HDG.QB.linkedContent: when question “What is…?” concerned w/ discussing (erörtern) the surpassing (Überstieg) of beings by Being, this surpassing immediately calls into question elements distinguished from one another in that distinction (Unterscheidung) [beyond ontological difference], the distinction in which doctrine of metaphysics moves, or from which metaphysics receives basic outline (Grundriss) of its language (essence/existence, what-being/that-being)

HDG.QB.content: question “What is metaphysics?” at first relies indiscriminately on distinction Being/being, but when it asks of Being’s surpassing of beings, becomes one of those questions that stabs itself in the heart, not so that thinking may thereby die, but live in transformed manner [living suicide] > ponder what is other than beings [Being as totally other?]
HDG.QB.linkedContent: question “What is metaphysics?” at first relies indiscriminately on distinction Being/being, but when it asks of Being’s surpassing of beings, becomes one of those questions that stabs itself in the heart, not so that thinking may thereby die, but live in transformed manner [living suicide] > ponder what is other than beings [Being as totally other?]

HDG.FS.content: driving force of subject-object dichotomy: quest for absolute certainty (Gewissheit), interpreting truth as certainty > Descartes’ ego cogito, as upokeimenon, subjectum, fundamentum inconcussum, henceforth, nature only appears as Object for a Subject > prelude to this advent: Luther’s quest for certainty in faith, Galileo’s search for mathematical certainty of nature, all prepared by nominalist separation of words/things, Ockham’s formalism makes possible project (Entwurf) of mathematical key (Schlüssels) to world > grasp in one concept: unity of mathematical certainty & certainty of salvation
HDG.FS.linkedContent: driving force of subject-object dichotomy: quest for absolute certainty (Gewissheit), interpreting truth as certainty > Descartes’ ego cogito, as upokeimenon, subjectum, fundamentum inconcussum, henceforth, nature only appears as Object for a Subject > prelude to this advent: Luther’s quest for certainty in faith, Galileo’s search for mathematical certainty of nature, all prepared by nominalist separation of words/things, Ockham’s formalism makes possible project (Entwurf) of mathematical key (Schlüssels) to world > grasp in one concept: unity of mathematical certainty & certainty of salvation

HDG.FS.content: work of seminar avoids merely historical questioning, protects itself against taking text as pretext for questions that would be “ours”
HDG.FS.linkedContent: work of seminar avoids merely historical questioning, protects itself against taking text as pretext for questions that would be “ours”

HDG.FS.content: the 1st question (historical-philosophical): concerns drive of dichotomy; the 2nd question (pre-philosophical approach [Annäherung]): unity before tearing/dichotomy?
HDG.FS.linkedContent: the 1st question (historical-philosophical): concerns drive of dichotomy; the 2nd question (pre-philosophical approach [Annäherung]): unity before tearing/dichotomy?

HDG.FS.content: “what is proper to all colors?” not Husserl’s question, who sought to clarify constitution of object in consciousness, phenomenologizes Kantian analysis of anticipations of perception
HDG.FS.linkedContent: “what is proper to all colors?” not Husserl’s question, who sought to clarify constitution of object in consciousness, phenomenologizes Kantian analysis of anticipations of perception

HDG.FS.content: in a sense, question of Being is entirely other (ganz andere) then that of metaphysics, which asks how being determines being as beings > question of Being inquires into Being as Being
HDG.FS.linkedContent: in a sense, question of Being is entirely other (ganz andere) then that of metaphysics, which asks how being determines being as beings > question of Being inquires into Being as Being

HDG.FS.content: [deconstructive method?] formulating question of Being in relation to Hegel can only be done on basis of Hegel’s text
HDG.FS.linkedContent: [deconstructive method?] formulating question of Being in relation to Hegel can only be done on basis of Hegel’s text

HDG.FS.content: God as Summum Ens, actus purus essendi—how does Aristotle’s energeia become actualitas? > Romans understood ergon, energeia, on basis of AGERE, “to make,” in an ontic sense, so Summum ens becomes CREATOR, ENS CREATUM (INCREATUM) > ontic determination of actualitas together w/ Aquinas’ Summum Ens w/ Ipsum esse, ontology suppresses possibility for question of Being > to restore (weider einsetzen) philosophy to its own essence: purge (entlasten) it of its Christian element
HDG.FS.linkedContent: God as Summum Ens, actus purus essendi—how does Aristotle’s energeia become actualitas? > Romans understood ergon, energeia, on basis of AGERE, “to make,” in an ontic sense, so Summum ens becomes CREATOR, ENS CREATUM (INCREATUM) > ontic determination of actualitas together w/ Aquinas’ Summum Ens w/ Ipsum esse, ontology suppresses possibility for question of Being > to restore (weider einsetzen) philosophy to its own essence: purge (entlasten) it of its Christian element

HDG.FS.content: Greek philosophers, more Greek than Greek, asked question of being but not question of alētheia as such > question concerning being as being never been posed (gestellt)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Greek philosophers, more Greek than Greek, asked question of being but not question of alētheia as such > question concerning being as being never been posed (gestellt)

HDG.FS.content: Being and Time asks not about a being but about “is,” addresses the question from perspective of meaning (Sinnes) of Being > “meaning of being”: understandable on basis (im Ausgang) of “project region” unfolded by “understanding of being” [hermeneutic circle?] > understanding: standing before, residing before (sich aufhalten vor), holding (halten) oneself at height of what stands before, being strong enough to hold out (auszuhalten)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Being and Time asks not about a being but about “is,” addresses the question from perspective of meaning (Sinnes) of Being > “meaning of being”: understandable on basis (im Ausgang) of “project region” unfolded by “understanding of being” [hermeneutic circle?] > understanding: standing before, residing before (sich aufhalten vor), holding (halten) oneself at height of what stands before, being strong enough to hold out (auszuhalten)

HDG.FS.content: unified question: being as position (Setzung) converges w/ totality of self-evident presuppositions & this convergence nourishes modern technological thinking > this unity evident in Kant’s title Metaphysical Foundations of Natural Science
HDG.FS.linkedContent: unified question: being as position (Setzung) converges w/ totality of self-evident presuppositions & this convergence nourishes modern technological thinking > this unity evident in Kant’s title Metaphysical Foundations of Natural Science

HDG.FS.content: [machine & event] difficult of thinking together question concerning technology & question of being
HDG.FS.linkedContent: [machine & event] difficult of thinking together question concerning technology & question of being

HDG.FS.content: [some historical reflections on Seinsfrage, includes Being and Time] from question of meaning of Being to truth of being to place or location of Being, thus “topology of Being”: 3 terms that succeed each other & 3 steps along way of thinking: MEANING-TRUTH-PLACE (topos)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: [some historical reflections on Seinsfrage, includes Being and Time] from question of meaning of Being to truth of being to place or location of Being, thus “topology of Being”: 3 terms that succeed each other & 3 steps along way of thinking: MEANING-TRUTH-PLACE (topos)

HDG.FS.content: Heidegger somewhat aligns himself w/ Marx, though he insists via question that every interpretation [of genuine thinking] can/must lead to transformation (Veränderung) of world > Heidegger also insists that praxis in Marx is determined by a theory of production as production of human itself (founded in Hegelian philosophy) > theory/praxis: sisters born from unknown parents [baby daddy]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Heidegger somewhat aligns himself w/ Marx, though he insists via question that every interpretation [of genuine thinking] can/must lead to transformation (Veränderung) of world > Heidegger also insists that praxis in Marx is determined by a theory of production as production of human itself (founded in Hegelian philosophy) > theory/praxis: sisters born from unknown parents [baby daddy]

HDG.FS.content: most extreme danger [the worst?]: man feels only necessity of self-production (question of computer language) > physics can’t leap beyond itself, nor can politics (which lives today in dimension of science)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: most extreme danger [the worst?]: man feels only necessity of self-production (question of computer language) > physics can’t leap beyond itself, nor can politics (which lives today in dimension of science)

HDG.FS.content: Heidegger’s question “Why are there beings/not nothing?” doesn’t seek 1st cause [like Leibniz? Schelling?], seeks to come out of forgetfulness of Being > his question authentically says: “how does it come about that you concern yourself so much w/ beings and so little w/ being?”
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Heidegger’s question “Why are there beings/not nothing?” doesn’t seek 1st cause [like Leibniz? Schelling?], seeks to come out of forgetfulness of Being > his question authentically says: “how does it come about that you concern yourself so much w/ beings and so little w/ being?”

HDG.FS.content: Heidegger’s question concerns being of being (Sein des Seins): truth (Wahrheit) of Being understood from preserving (Bewahren)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: Heidegger’s question concerns being of being (Sein des Seins): truth (Wahrheit) of Being understood from preserving (Bewahren)

HDG.FS.content: for Husserl, substantiality [categorial?], non-appearance, (of book), enables what appears to appear, more apparent that what itself appears > w/ categorial intution, Husserl freed being from its attachment to judgment reorients entire field of investigation > if Heidegger poses question of meaning of being, must already be beyond being, understood as being of beings [Befragte: Being; das Erfragte: meaning of Being]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: for Husserl, substantiality [categorial?], non-appearance, (of book), enables what appears to appear, more apparent that what itself appears > w/ categorial intution, Husserl freed being from its attachment to judgment reorients entire field of investigation > if Heidegger poses question of meaning of being, must already be beyond being, understood as being of beings [Befragte: Being; das Erfragte: meaning of Being]

HDG.FS.content: to unfold question of meaning of Being, Being must be given > Husserl succeeded in this making present of Being, phenomenally present in category > Husserl gave Heidegger ground: “being” no mere concept, no pure abstraction > Husserl doesn’t inquire forth into Being after reaching Being as given, doesn’t ask what it means > no question for Husserl, “being” means being-object (but objectivity is a mode of presence)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: to unfold question of meaning of Being, Being must be given > Husserl succeeded in this making present of Being, phenomenally present in category > Husserl gave Heidegger ground: “being” no mere concept, no pure abstraction > Husserl doesn’t inquire forth into Being after reaching Being as given, doesn’t ask what it means > no question for Husserl, “being” means being-object (but objectivity is a mode of presence)

HDG.FS.content: [encountering immediate/concrete categorial is not unfolding question of truth of Being]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: [encountering immediate/concrete categorial is not unfolding question of truth of Being]

HDG.MA.content: decisive question: how can we tame vast atomic energies, secure mankind against their danger > technological advance will move faster & faster, can’t be stopped > man hasn’t made forces of technology [?], they’ve moved beyond his will, outgrown his capacity for decision
HDG.MA.linkedContent: decisive question: how can we tame vast atomic energies, secure mankind against their danger > technological advance will move faster & faster, can’t be stopped > man hasn’t made forces of technology [?], they’ve moved beyond his will, outgrown his capacity for decision

HDG.DL.content: [back to path of question of hermeneutics] hermeneutics als Beiwort to “phenomenology,” means the interpretation itself [not hermeneutics usual meaning] > explaining etymology of hermeneutics will help clarify Heidegger’s intention (Absicht) w/ experiment (Versuch) of phenomenology > Japaner points out Heidegger has now dropped both words [along his path] > not done to deny phenomenology, but to abandon (lassen) my path of thinking to namelessness > which can’t be successful > because public requires rubric (Titel)
HDG.DL.linkedContent: [back to path of question of hermeneutics] hermeneutics als Beiwort to “phenomenology,” means the interpretation itself [not hermeneutics usual meaning] > explaining etymology of hermeneutics will help clarify Heidegger’s intention (Absicht) w/ experiment (Versuch) of phenomenology > Japaner points out Heidegger has now dropped both words [along his path] > not done to deny phenomenology, but to abandon (lassen) my path of thinking to namelessness > which can’t be successful > because public requires rubric (Titel)

HDG.TC.content: philosophers don’t just tread in place, they go backwards > not every answer is an answer to a question, if the essence of man is the answer, the question of its essence was never raised?
HDG.TC.linkedContent: philosophers don’t just tread in place, they go backwards > not every answer is an answer to a question, if the essence of man is the answer, the question of its essence was never raised?

HDG.OHF.content: “ontology”: doctrine (Lehre) of Being > “ontology” & “ontological” only be used in empty sense (leeren Sinne) mentioned above of nonbonding indications (unverbindliche Anzeige): a question (Frage) and defining (Bestimmen) toward Being as such (auf Sein als solches)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: “ontology”: doctrine (Lehre) of Being > “ontology” & “ontological” only be used in empty sense (leeren Sinne) mentioned above of nonbonding indications (unverbindliche Anzeige): a question (Frage) and defining (Bestimmen) toward Being as such (auf Sein als solches)

HDG.OHF.content: questions grow out of confrontation (Auseinandersetzung) w/ “subject matter (Sachen)” > subject matter there (da) only where eyes are
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: questions grow out of confrontation (Auseinandersetzung) w/ “subject matter (Sachen)” > subject matter there (da) only where eyes are

HDG.OHF.content: [insidious logic] forehaving of interpretation, that it can’t be present as thematic object clear sign (Anzeichen) of its Seinscharakters, constitutive of interpretation, shares in character of Dasein’s being: Möglichsein (being-possible), modifies itself out of the situation to which the hermeneutic question is operating (Vorhabe not arbitrary/acc. whim)
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: [insidious logic] forehaving of interpretation, that it can’t be present as thematic object clear sign (Anzeichen) of its Seinscharakters, constitutive of interpretation, shares in character of Dasein’s being: Möglichsein (being-possible), modifies itself out of the situation to which the hermeneutic question is operating (Vorhabe not arbitrary/acc. whim)

HDG.OHF.content: dialectic must sideline itself re: fundamental task (i.e. work out question of object & how to decide it) > dialectic can’t stay w/ object & allow object to prescribe (vorgeben) “right mode of grasping it and the limits to this”
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: dialectic must sideline itself re: fundamental task (i.e. work out question of object & how to decide it) > dialectic can’t stay w/ object & allow object to prescribe (vorgeben) “right mode of grasping it and the limits to this”

HDG.OHF.content: two modes of Dasein of today (Dasein im Heute) (discourse about Dasein) [initial givens of today, closest to us? (Zunächst des Heute)] (: 1) historical consciousness 2) philosophy > modes of interpreting, modes of Dasein’s having-itself in a definite manner, must interrogate these modes to interrogate Dasein of today, to subject the today to a destruction > genuine question of hermeneutics: what Seinscharakter of Dasein shows up (zeigt sich) [cf. Sage as showing] in these modes of having-itself (Sichselbstshabens)?
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: two modes of Dasein of today (Dasein im Heute) (discourse about Dasein) [initial givens of today, closest to us? (Zunächst des Heute)] (: 1) historical consciousness 2) philosophy > modes of interpreting, modes of Dasein’s having-itself in a definite manner, must interrogate these modes to interrogate Dasein of today, to subject the today to a destruction > genuine question of hermeneutics: what Seinscharakter of Dasein shows up (zeigt sich) [cf. Sage as showing] in these modes of having-itself (Sichselbstshabens)?

HDG.OHF.content: Husserl’s object didn’t change, but the how of interrogating/defining it did, question of access (Zugangsfrage): a descriptive method (not a constructivist one) > “phenomenon” not primarily a category, but deals w/ how of access/grasping/safekeeping (Verwahrung), phenomenology (initially) nothing more than mode of research/inquiry (Weise der Forschung): “addressing (Ansprechen) something just as it shows (zeigt) itself and only to the extent that it shows itself”
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: Husserl’s object didn’t change, but the how of interrogating/defining it did, question of access (Zugangsfrage): a descriptive method (not a constructivist one) > “phenomenon” not primarily a category, but deals w/ how of access/grasping/safekeeping (Verwahrung), phenomenology (initially) nothing more than mode of research/inquiry (Weise der Forschung): “addressing (Ansprechen) something just as it shows (zeigt) itself and only to the extent that it shows itself”

HDG.OHF.content: Heidegger describes how transcendental idealism entered phenomenology [via Dilthey?] &, as a countermovement, traditional realism > no one asked whether epistemological questions are meaningless in phenomenology
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: Heidegger describes how transcendental idealism entered phenomenology [via Dilthey?] &, as a countermovement, traditional realism > no one asked whether epistemological questions are meaningless in phenomenology

HDG.OHF.content: forehaving: what is had in advance re: accessing/dealing w/ matter in question > fate of our approach (das Schicksal des Ansatzes) hangs on the primordiality (Ürsprunglichkeit) & genuineness (Echtheit) of the forehaving (in which Dasein as such [factical life] has been placed) [how can you ever assess forehaving unless you simply presume proximity?]
HDG.OHF.linkedContent: forehaving: what is had in advance re: accessing/dealing w/ matter in question > fate of our approach (das Schicksal des Ansatzes) hangs on the primordiality (Ürsprunglichkeit) & genuineness (Echtheit) of the forehaving (in which Dasein as such [factical life] has been placed) [how can you ever assess forehaving unless you simply presume proximity?]
